comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: My bet is that this is Gresley Lukin, a 19th century Brisbane press figure etc. I'm sure that I've seen an etching taken from this pic somewhere...maybe in an issue of 'Queensland Figaro' or 'Queensland Punch'. This 1879 'Illustrated Sydney News' sketch is inconclusive - nla.gov.au/nla.news-article63335825

comment.author: 32605636@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51979177@N02] It's possible, although the portrait in his Wikipedia entry en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gresley_Lukin looks quite different. That said, there is another image of him as an older man in our collection where the resemblance closer - hdl.handle.net/10462/deriv/133132 It's not conclusive enough to call but I tend to agree that it is most likely Lukin. Thanks for the research. It's great to have people interested and willing to help us improve our knowledge of photos in our collections.

comment.author: 51979177@N02
comment._content: Going on the image of Lukin as an older man, I'd say that this isn't Lukin. Lukin's hairline is lower and there are a couple of other features which don't quite stack up. So, my revised position is that I'm fairly sure that I've seen this pic (or an etching taken from this pic) in a 19th century newspaper. But I won't bet on it this time.
